newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-DMG Radio buys Adelaide station 5AA.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-DMG Radio buys Adelaide station 5AA.

text.p: DMG Radio Australia, a unit of Britain's Daily Mail and General Trust Plc, has bought Adelaide radio station 5AA for A$7.5 million, subject to final adjustments, the South Australian government said on Wednesday.
State Racing Minister Graham Ingerson said in a statement the sale price to DMG Radio Australia, a subsdiary of the Daily Mail's DMG Radio, was well above market expectations.

The AM station 5AA has been owned since 1984 by the state-run South Australian Totalisator Agency Board (TAB), which also ran the narrow-cast radio licence TABRadio for broadcasting horse racing information.
As part of the sale process, 5AA had been contracted to manage TABRadio for five years in a commercial contract which was favourable to the TAB, Ingerson said.
The TAB would continue to hold the TABRadio licence, he said.
DMG Radio Australia announced on Tuesday it had agreed to buy Broadcast Media, a privately-held company owning 12 regional radio stations in Australia.
Its British parent announced on later on Tuesday it had paid A$46 million or 23.4 million stg for an 85 percent economic and a 100 percent voting interest in Broadcast Media.
DMG Radio Australia was set up in February to expand DMG Radio's interests in Australia.

Thompson said DMG Radio aimed to use Broadcast Media as a base for expansion both regionally and within the various state capital radio markets, both by buying existing stations and buying licenses for fresh stations.
